en.sc1: Here is a graphical depiction for a linked list storing five integers. The value stored in a pointer variable is indicated by an arrow "pointing" to something. A NULL pointer is indicated graphically by a diagonal slash through a pointer variable's box.
en.sc2: The list's first node is accessed from a pointer named head. To speed access to the end of the list, tail points to the last node of the list.
en.sc3: Here is what we would like to have happen when we delete the node holding the value 10 -- notice how the node holding 23 now connects with the node holding 12.
